intro: Lappula redowskii var. patula, commonly known as the slender lappia, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
